title: Can we report people for calling themselves challenger and then dying 13 times.
body: In a low sliver game like honestly i feel like its very disrespectful to the higher elo players who actually achieved challenger because any challenger dying that amount of times in a SLIVER game should be ashamed, embarrassed or simply not challenger at all. This guy legit told us in lobby to report him if he didn't carry us and claimed to be Korean challenger. Then he picks {{champion:67}} and goes jungle. Its one thing to call yourself a smurf and feed but this ? Thank god i had a brain and managed to end the game. From the champion select to the game i was already shaking my head. Its not acceptable to lie about something like that and give your team a false hope only to feed its tilting af.

replies.body: To me, this seems like an odd thing to be hung up about. People brag about their skill level all the time, either as a joke or because they have low self esteem. Either way, it's not something to overthink.
I get those players time to time too. But ive never had someone who claimed to be challenger and share his twitch stream via all chat (i didn't even bother to remember it.)

Oh, I've certainly had those before. I supported a Draven about a month ago that shared his twitch stream, generally sucked in lane (though I got him fed because I'm amazing at this game), flamed anybody who made a mistake, literally threatened "ff or I afk" when we started losing, and then just indefinitely farmed bot lane while our inhibitors were taken. I can't imagine he had any viewers. Some people just can't accept their own faults.

No, we laugh at them, for that is almost hilariously sad. I mean how big is your ego if you think you can seem like a challenger if you are actually silver. The narcissism is real here.

Yeah in my last match i was facing this jax and our annie gets his flash and he types in all chat like 
{{champion:24}} "Nice you actually got it"
{{champion:1}} "????"
{{champion:24}} "My flash good job"

XDDDD i was dying like it reminded me of those anime shows where the bad guy is bragging about his power for half an episode.

"This is only my 2nd form"

But seriously every guy i ever had say he was smurfing ALWAYS feeds its like a PRE tilt in lobby for me.
i normally laugh my head of and know not to trust them when they say they are a smurf.

Protip: If someone brags about their rank, they are most likely not that rank.

(Unless its gold, in which case they probably are and actually think its something to be proud of.)
